etymologies: said to have been invented by the journalist Arthur Wynne, whose puzzle (called a ‘word-cross’) appeared in a Sunday newspaper, the New York World, on 21 December 1913

definitions: a puzzle consisting of a grid of squares and blanks into which words crossing vertically and horizontally are written according to clues

examples.text: she settled down to do the crossword

shortDefinitions: puzzle consisting of grid of squares and blanks into which words crossing vertically and horizontally are written according to clues
